Senior Game Designer
description: This is a Fully Remote Position on the West CoastLess than 10% Travel is Required**About the role**You’ll work directly with the leadership team to help realize our vision of making a truly fun, engaging educational game that teaches kids how to code, with an emphasis on fun! We’re a small, scrappy team that all wear multiple hats, so be prepared to do the same.As a Game Designer at Kodable you’ll be responsible for crafting the experiences and tools to help kids evolve their programming skills as part of a close and collaborative team. You will be the owner of creating fun and educational features, game loops, and user generated content systems. As a principle, you’ll regularly interact with artists, engineers, and marketing. Autonomy and self direction will be critical for success in this role, as well as exemplifying Kodable’s core values of Communication, Authenticity, and Accountability.**Who we’re looking for:**You care deeply about bringing computer science to kidsYou have 3+ years experience designing for live games or GaaS titles, with a focus on systems, progression, and gameplayYou have experience working games for younger childrenYou're confident in your ability to keep players engaged and coming back for moreYou have experience navigating the constraints of small, mission driven development teamsYou thrive on collaboration, design is an iterative process and the first idea isn’t always the best oneYou are unafraid of getting your hands dirty with all aspects of design and iterationsYou have a passion for games, and love dissecting and studying games for fun**Highly preferable if:**You have hands-on experience with UnityYou’re unafraid of rapid prototypingYou have a strong background in mobile and F2P gamesYou understand core computer science concepts such as classes, function, booleans, and loopsYou have experience working in a startup environment**Bonus Points for:**Experience Designing for UGC gamesExperience in STEM educationLetting us know why you want to work here! Our founders read every application!

title: Lead Build Game Engineer
description: Job descriptionNOTE: W2 hourly only, no C2C please.NOTE: This is a remote role, US-based candidates only.NOTE: No sponsorship is available for this role, now or in the future. Please do not submit candidates that require sponsorship.NOTE: Ideal candidates would come from Epic Games, Paradox, or firaxis games.Lead Build Game Engineer We are looking for a Lead Build Game Engineer to work with one of its long-time clients located in the Seattle area on a team that develops many of today's top video game franchises. The candidate:Must have a strong background building and operating large scale build infrastructure. We’re looking for someone with strong communication skills and a self-driven approach to work.The ideal candidate understands AAA game development (NOTE: this is ABSOLUTELY REQUIRED), enjoys collaborating with internal and external partners, and has a track record for delivering high quality infrastructure with a passion for operational excellence. NOTE: A qualified applicant must have experience developing and maintaining large scale, reliable, secure build services and the tools needed to use them.ResponsibilitiesResponsible for our build infrastructure including ability to produce roadmap, estimate time and cost required to accomplish new features, improve automation, increase reliability and improve observability.Operate and maintain build infrastructure used across the game/franchise portfolio.Provide troubleshooting and timely resolution of system, network, and infrastructure problems.Be available for 24x7 on-call rotations.Qualifications8+ years of professional experience in AAA scale Unreal Engine game developmentAutomated CI/CD pipeline (e.g., Azure DevOps (preferred), Jenkins)Content Tools and Pipelines4+ years experience with scripting languages (python, bash, ruby, etc.)4+ years experience with compiled object oriented languages (C++, Go, C#, etc.)4+ years experience administering Perforce source control systems4+ years experience building infra on Azure or AWSExpertise in implementing automated unit and integration testsStrong verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, customer service and interpersonal skills.Strong ability to work independently and manage time efficiently.Bonus skillsDeep understanding of Unreal Engine’s build pipeline and asset management systemsExperience supporting Perforce based CI/CD pipelinesExperience in working with non-engineering disciplinesExperience in working with remote teamsExperience with infrastructure tools like Kubernetes and Docker

title: Senior Gameplay Engineer
description: We are looking for a Gameplay Engineer with diverse interests in building rich, immersive online worlds, an engineer who can work directly with designers and other disciplines to build game systems, explore design ideas, and seek ways to use technology to enable more compelling experiences.As an experienced Gameplay Engineer, you will share your knowledge and experience with both veteran and junior teammates. You will be a resource to them for questions, architectural advice, and general help where needed.Do you like the idea of empowering and working with world-class game designers and storytellers? Are you excited by mentoring engineers and sharing your expertise? If you are interested in pushing the boundaries of how games are made and played, we would love to hear from you!About Our Team The Engineering team at ArenaNet thrives on a wide array of perspectives, experiences, and interests. We know that the best creations come from healthy and friendly teams. Our work is woven together with the efforts of other disciplines and crafts within game development. We seek out voices and ideas that might be new to us. We are always on the lookout for ways to help each other, both within the Engineering team, and throughout the studio as a whole.Who We Are Looking ForYou, our ideal candidate, will need to be very comfortable in C++ and able to rapidly try ideas to see what works best, based on feedback from other veteran engineers and seasoned game designers. You will understand the performance costs of gameplay systems and how to diagnose, debug, and optimize them.Listening and communication skills will, at this point in your career, be natural to you. You will use your strong listening skills to understand design goals and will be able to creatively synthesize solutions for those goals based on your experience and the capabilities of the engine. Your strong communication skills will be used to present those options in a way that makes sense to designers and the rest of the team.Mentoring and teaching are activities that you take pleasure in as part of your day-to-day endeavors. You enjoy evangelizing best practices based on your experience with game development and respectfully guiding and mentoring teammates.ArenaNet is committed to celebrating and nurturing our staff, along with our wide variety of perspectives, backgrounds, experiences, and ideas, so you will need to be willing to engage and collaborate with a range of other team members within the studio, as well as uphold our collective values.What You'll Need To Be SuccessfulBachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.5 years of programming experiencePlease note: We encourage you to apply even if you don't feel you fully meet all these requirements, however, proficiency with C++ is a MUST HAVE for this position.We are open to remote work from the following states: AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, ID, IL, MD, NC, NY, OR, TX, UT, WA and WI or onsite/hybrid/flex at our office in Bellevue, WA.Total compensation is salary plus an annual bonus potential. Please note that the listed pay range is a general guideline only. We take into consideration the geography in which you live and your experience and qualifications when determining final salary. This role is also eligible for medical, dental, vision and life insurance, short and long term disability, 401(k), flexible and dependent care spending accounts, PTO, paid holidays and parental leave.Remote pay range$128,000—$190,000 USD

title: Esports Game Player
description: Company DescriptionGames for Love is a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization that works to ease suffering, save lives, and create sustainable futures for children. We believe in the concept of "distraction therapy" and bring the joy of gaming into the lives of our junior gamers in hospitals around the country. We plan to help 10 million kids in the next 5 years. We have a healthy ecosystem to achieve that goal with your intelligent contribution.Job DescriptionAs an Esports Game Player at Games for Love League of Pros Esports, you will have the unique opportunity to combine your passion for gaming with philanthropy. You will be a vital part of our mission to make a positive impact on the lives of children facing health challenges. This position is a volunteer role.Key Responsibilities:Competitive Gameplay:Compete in esports tournaments and matches across various gaming titles.Maintain a high level of skill and proficiency in your chosen games.Collaborate with teammates to strategize and execute winning strategies.Able to donate approx. 10-20 hrs. a week for at least 6-12 months Represent Games for Love:Embody the values and mission of Games for Love in all interactions.Act as an ambassador for our organization during esports events and streams.Community Engagement:Interact with the gaming and esports community to promote Games for Love and our events.Engage with our audience through live streams, social media, and other online platforms.Fundraising Support:Participate in charity matches and events to raise funds for our cause.Encourage donations and sponsorships during your streams and competitions.Teamwork and Communication:Collaborate with other players, coaches, and staff to ensure effective communication and teamwork.Provide constructive feedback to help improve team performance.Self-Improvement:Continuously work on improving your gaming skills through practice and training.Stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the esports industry.QualificationsVolunteer grants approvedStrong proficiency in multiple esports titles (e.g., League of Legends, Dota 2, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, Overwatch, etc.).Passion for gaming and a desire to make a positive impact on the lives of children.Excellent communication skills and the ability to engage with a diverse audience.Experience in competitive gaming and a track record of success in esports competitions.Ability to work well in a team and adapt to various game genres and strategies.Familiarity with live streaming platforms and social media is a plus.Additional InformationBenefits:Work from anywhere on earth - 100% remote Massive networking opportunities with 500+ members of our communityLevel up your skillsMake a big impact in the worldHave lots of fun partnering with passionate game developersJoin the mastermind group and learn from top game developersVolunteer recognition & awardsGames for Love is an equal opportunity organization. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, or any other legally protected status.

title: Gameplay Engineer
description: Pikemann is seeking a creative Gameplay Engineer who can collaborate with our mission designers to create engaging and innovative missions.You will work with multidisciplinary teams, including designers, artists, and other engineers, to ensure the smooth integration of gameplay elements that improve player satisfaction and enjoyment. You need to have strong problem-solving skills, and familiarity with Unreal Engine is highly desirable.Responsibilities:Work with game director and other team members to create engaging missions in dynamic environments using C++ and Unreal Blueprints.Implement and improve methods for generating game events and objectives that elicit emotional responses from players.Observe playtests and provide feedback to enhance gameplay features and integration with other technical systems.Requirements:C++ programming expertise.Visual scripting experience, preferably with Unreal Engine.Knowledge of networking and multiplayer game development.Ability to design and implement gameplay features that support the mission objectives and gameplay loop.Passion for tactical FPS games and mission design.Benefits:Comprehensive coverage for your family's medical, dental, and vision needs; and a 401(k).Flexible PTO: Our team does not have a fixed number of vacation days. No long vesting periods or complicated seniority levels, when the game is profitable, the team is profitable.To apply, please submit your resume to marco@pikemann.comThis is a remote position.

title: Software Engineer
description: Manager, Software Engineering At PlayEveryWare, no two projects are exactly alike. We work on cutting edge technology and bring games to previous and current generation consoles. Each project brings exciting new technical challenges and opportunities to learn, adapt, and grow. We invite you to join our team of experienced industry veterans to stretch the limits of your skills and push your expertise into new areas with these unique projects. As an Engineering Manager at PlayEveryWare, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our engineering team. Your responsibilities extend beyond project management to actively fostering the growth and development of each team member. You'll be instrumental in recruiting top talent, ensuring that our team not only maintains its high standards but also continues to evolve with the industry's best. Additionally, you'll be charged with continually assessing and refining our engineering processes. This role requires a balance of technical expertise, leadership acumen, and a visionary approach to team development and process innovation. Your contributions will directly impact the efficiency, effectiveness, and culture of our engineering team, making you a key driver of our continued success in the dynamic world of game development. If you excel in leading teams towards innovative solutions, are adept at navigating and improving complex systems, and possess exceptional strategic, technical, and communication skills, we invite you to lead our team to new heights. Responsibilities Guide and mentor software engineers from multiple teams, fostering an environment of growth and development Work with technical leads to help them guide the architecture, design, and development of software systems, ensuring alignment with project goals and company standards Manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables in collaboration with other departments Conduct code reviews and maintain high standards of code quality and system reliability Facilitate effective communication and collaboration within the team and with external partners Develop and implement strategies for continuous improvement in development processes and team performance Foster leadership and ownership throughout the studio Guide teams in problem-solving and decision-making for technical challenges Contribute to the recruitment, hiring, and onboarding of engineers Contribute to fostering a healthy satisfied team and sustainable company culture that is aligned with the company’s values Cultivate a proactive work culture and lead by example to anticipate challenges, streamline processes, and ensure timely resolution of issues Qualifications 5+ years of experience in the games industry or 10+ years in a related field, demonstrating strong leadership and success in diverse codebases Deep proficiency in C/C++ and familiarity with multiplatform development 2+ years of experience with Unreal Engine (UE4/UE5) Expertise in Perforce and Git version control systems Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills Proven ability in project risk management, task organization, and milestone operationalization Strong adaptability, task management, and delegation skills Experience developing on game consoles and proficient in debugging across multiple devices BA/BS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent experience Commitment to studio values, including active listening, empathy, and servant leadership Vast technical knowledge across multiple engineering disciplines Nice to have 2+ years of professional experience with Unity and a strong command of C# Experience shipping at least one high-profile or professional game title in UE4 Development experience on current-generation game consoles, with a history of leading engineering teams in console development Proficiency in Japanese for communication with teams and partners Benefits & Perks 100% covered health care, vision, dental insurance with affordable options for addition of dependents 401(k) retirement savings and profit sharing plan Life and disability insurance, Healthcare Savings Account 56 hours of sick time, 11 floating holidays, and additional PTO No Mandatory Crunch policy Close relationships with Epic, Unity, and first-party console developers Open and Location: Hybrid remote in Seattle, WA 98108

title: Quality Assurance Tester
description: We're ArenaNet. We make the games we want to play and infuse them with innovation, hand-crafted detail, and creative passion. As developer and publisher of the award-winning Guild Wars game series, we're proud to share our passion for the online worlds we've created with over 11 million players worldwide. We are looking for a QA Tester to test all aspects and systems of all assigned games to ensure that they meet or exceed quality standards. As a QA Tester, you will record bugs and report them in the appropriate tracking software. WHAT YOU'LL DO Using established methods, test games for ease of use, reliability, consistency, and absence of defects Execute functionality test plans and checklists Log and regress all defects found during testing into the appropriate defect tracking software Provide clear and detailed written reports of bugs and repro steps to the development team Bring serious defects to the attention of QA Leadership WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL High school diploma or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience 1-3 years of experience with software QA testing, preferably video game QA testing Strong attention to detail Excellent written and verbal communication skills Able to multi-task and work successfully under tight deadlines Computer proficiency, especially in relation to video games Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Familiar with Jira or another bug-tracking system Interested in and comfortable with MMO gaming Working knowledge of Zephyr or comparable test case management product This is a hybrid position based out of our Bellevue, WA office. Total compensation is salary plus annual bonus potential. Please note that the listed pay range is a general guideline only. We take into consideration your experience and qualifications when determining final salary. This role is also eligible for medical, dental, vision and life insurance, short and long term disability, 401(k), flexible and dependent care spending accounts, PTO, paid holidays and parental leave. Bellevue pay range $38,430—$51,880 USD

title: Principal Software Engineer
description: Would you like to be at the forefront of AI and Gaming and work with state-of-the-art AI research and the top gaming studios in the world? Are you a high-performance tech lead that loves to design and build world-changing products while leading and mentoring a team of developers? At Xbox Emerging Technologies, we are exploring new emerging technology trends to craft the next era of gaming. We are venturing beyond the horizon and charting a course forward with players and creators at the center. Our goal is to define the future of Xbox by advancing our mission of bringing joy and community to every player on the planet. If you value dynamic and agile teams that are proactively advocating for a diverse workforce, we have a great role for you. We are seeking a highly skilled Principal Software Development Engineer to join our team at Xbox Emerging Technology to lead the team that is building the next generation of game development tools powered by AI. As a key contributor, you will be responsible for driving innovation and excellence in software development, focusing on machine learning (ML) systems and developing scalable products that leverage the latest AI. You will play a pivotal role in delivering products in the gaming industry that empower developers to create the best games in the world. If you are a forward-thinking principal level engineer passionate about leadership in cutting-edge technology and possess an effective foundation in cloud, automation, ML, and AI, we encourage you to apply. At Xbox, we're committed to inclusivity and diversity. Even if you don't meet all qualifications listed, we welcome your application. Your unique perspective and potential contributions are highly valued here. Responsibilities Hands-on leadership of a team of product-focused software developers. Implementing AI models into scalable platforms that accelerate game development. Working across research, data science, and product management teams to ensure successful customer-centric solutions. Design and implement Azure based solutions to scale ML/AI solutions across Xbox. Craft clean, efficient, and maintainable code across a range of technologies, including but not limited to Python, PowerShell, C#, and C++. Qualifications Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related technical discipline AND 6+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience. 3+ years experience leading cross-functional and/or cross-team projects. 4+ years of cloud-native software development experience. Preferred Qualifications: Ability to lead through example and influence. 10+ years of experience leading teams of software engineers. Effective problem-solving acumen and critical thinking skills. Experience in building new products or features from the ground up. Over 10 years of experience leading teams and building production level systems. Experience implementing RPA based solutions in Windows. Experience in videogame development, particularly in automation. Experience deploying, scaling, and managing containerized applications in Azure Previous exposure to Agile/Scrum development methodologies. Automation experience with Azure, particularly with Windows on Azure. Over 10 years of experience leading teams and building production level systems. Experience implementing RPA based solutions in Windows. Experience in videogame development, particularly in automation. Experience deploying, scaling, and managing containerized applications in Azure Previous exposure to Agile/Scrum development methodologies. Software Engineering M5 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $133,600 - $256,800 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $173,200 - $282,200 per year. Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Principal Product Manager
description: 9+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables) Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional marketing programs Experience driving direction and alignment with cross-functional teams Are you interested in being part of team that is helping Amazon enter an emerging market segment with incredible potential? Are you the kind of person who thrives in an environment where you get to invent on behalf of customers every day? Are you able to quickly analyze customer data to identify meaningful, actionable insights that improve business performance? Do you have a successful track record of defining high impact campaigns for consumer products? Do you have a knack for creating high quality marketing deliverables that crisply convey customer value propositions? Bring your entrepreneurial mindset and drive to deliver results to the Amazon Luna Sales and Marketing team! As a Principal Product Marketing Manager, you will develop and deliver partner marketing programs that enable the Luna business to grow through and with partners. You will own defining, developing, executing and analyze high-impact co-marketing campaigns with top tier game developers, game publishers and other partners to acquire new customers, retain and grow existing customers and deliver subscriber and revenue growth. You will collaborate across our BD, Product, and Engineering teams to establish strong, collaborative, “trusted advisor” relationships with partners through the recruiting, GTM and customer activation lifecycle. Our growth requires a leader who makes sound decisions at speed, has a true “owner” mentality, brings a relentless focus to getting things done, and thrives on breaking down and solving complex problems. We are seeking someone who is creative, highly analytical, customer-obsessed, and excels at earning trust with stakeholders. The right candidate will have demonstrated experience in developing go-to-market and/or co-marketing programs. They will have a proven record of leading and driving multiple programs to meet business objectives, excellent program and project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment and be passionate about launching new products and experiences for consumers. Key job responsibilities Drive growth and scale for Amazon Luna by leading go-to-market planning and launching world-class co-marketing campaigns with third-party content partners that are impactful to the business, drive growth and increase brand and product awareness. Develop detailed campaign project plans, including campaign goals, messaging, call-to-action, marketing distribution channels, follow-up activities, and success metrics. Present new partner marketing proposals and analysis of active campaigns in recurring business reviews with senior leadership. Help improve and build new go-to-market mechanisms including playbooks, toolkits, and processes to enable the team to scale more effectively and efficiently across new partners, channels and regions Inform the product roadmap with customer and partner insights to influence the product roadmap and drive innovation. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Bellevue, WA, USA | Irvine, CA, USA Experience with creating GTM initiatives at scale Experience working cross-functionally across marketing, product management, analytics, UX, and research Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $136,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $252,900/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Do you have a successful track record of defining high impact campaigns for consumer products? Do you have a knack for creating high quality marketing deliverables that crisply convey customer value propositions? Bring your entrepreneurial mindset and drive to deliver results to the Amazon Luna Sales and Marketing team! As a Principal Product Marketing Manager, you will develop and deliver partner marketing programs that enable the Luna business to grow through and with partners. You will own defining, developing, executing and analyze high-impact co-marketing campaigns with top tier game developers, game publishers and other partners to acquire new customers, retain and grow existing customers and deliver subscriber and revenue growth. You will collaborate across our BD, Product, and Engineering teams to establish strong, collaborative, “trusted advisor” relationships with partners through the recruiting, GTM and customer activation lifecycle. Our growth requires a leader who makes sound decisions at speed, has a true “owner” mentality, brings a relentless focus to getting things done, and thrives on breaking down and solving complex problems. We are seeking someone who is creative, highly analytical, customer-obsessed, and excels at earning trust with stakeholders. The right candidate will have demonstrated experience in developing go-to-market and/or co-marketing programs. They will have a proven record of leading and driving multiple programs to meet business objectives, excellent program and project management skills, a customer-obsessed and collaborative approach, strong data and metrics bias, be a self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment and be passionate about launching new products and experiences for consumers. Key job responsibilities Drive growth and scale for Amazon Luna by leading go-to-market planning and launching world-class co-marketing campaigns with third-party content partners that are impactful to the business, drive growth and increase brand and product awareness. Develop detailed campaign project plans, including campaign goals, messaging, call-to-action, marketing distribution channels, follow-up activities, and success metrics. Present new partner marketing proposals and analysis of active campaigns in recurring business reviews with senior leadership. Help improve and build new go-to-market mechanisms including playbooks, toolkits, and processes to enable the team to scale more effectively and efficiently across new partners, channels and regions Inform the product roadmap with customer and partner insights to influence the product roadmap and drive innovation. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Bellevue, WA, USA | Irvine, CA, USA Experience working with multiple groups of stakeholders Experience in e-commerce, digital products or entertainment industries Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. title: Technical Program Manager
description: 7+ years of working directly with engineering teams experience 5+ years of technical product or program management experience 3+ years of software development experience 5+ years of technical program management working directly with software engineering teams experience Experience managing programs across cross functional teams, building processes and coordinating release schedules Come build the future as a Technical Program Manager III at Amazon, where you will be inspired working alongside best-in-class inventors and innovators! You will have the opportunity to create meaningful experiences that deliver on the ever-evolving needs of our customers, and your work will impact millions of people around the world. Apply now and you will be eligible for Amazon Technical Program Manager III positions that are based on your preferred location, team, tech stack, domain, language and more. We’re hiring across Amazon Stores in the United States and Canada. Teams with available positions including, but are not limited to: Consumer Technology: Build new generation features and products for amazon.com, constantly improving the Customer and Seller experience for billions around the globe. Whether building site wide features such as reviews and recommendations, category specific software for the likes of Pharmacy, Electronics, Digital Software and Video Games or seller infrastructure, there are a variety of complex problems to tackle using a range of technologies in the design of your technical solutions. Operations Technology: Shape the future of transportation planning and execution on a global scale, that impacts hundreds of fulfillment centers, thousands of Amazonians, and millions of customers across the world. Your technology will support thousands of operators worldwide to design, build and run the best-in-class Amazon transportation network. We are building intelligent software to make transportation more reliable, faster, and less costly, providing a better and less expensive experience for our customers. Financial Technology: Create next generation of distributed, scalable financial systems that support Amazon's current and future business needs. Use big data technologies to design and develop services that facilitate global financial transactions worth billions annually. You’ll lead architecture, design, implementation and deployment of large-scale critical and complex financial applications, owning all aspects of solutions end-to-end, through full stack software development. Human Resources Technology: Create a seamless experience for millions of Amazonians and/or candidates. Whether supporting technologies for onboarding, time and attendance, compensation, amazon.jobs, or recruiting, you’ll deliver robust feature sets, elegant designs, intuitive user interfaces and systems that make it easy for Amazonians to excel at performing critical business functions. Depending on your experience, Technical Program Manager III can typically expect to directly engage with developers and customers to address challenging problems, build software with the latest technologies and make data-driven decisions to improve the customer experience. Your responsibilities extend to scaling systems by managing internal and external stakeholders across various domains, from business and operations to engineering, science, and deployment. As a Senior TPM, you will navigate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, make strategic tradeoffs, and balance business needs with technical constraints. The role also involves scoping and delivering large projects end-to-end, collecting requirements, writing specifications, and coordinating design/implementation efforts. Ideally, you possess a strong program management background, demonstrated experience leading medium to large projects, and a well-rounded technical proficiency in current web technologies. About Us Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives. Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign opportunities based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded contributor. Inclusive Team Culture Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Arlington, VA, USA | Austin, TX, USA | Bellevue, WA, USA | Boston, MA, USA | Dallas, TX, USA | Nashville, TN, USA | Palo Alto, CA, USA | Seattle, WA, USA | Sunnyvale, CA, USA 5+ years of project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, quality, along with risk and critical path management experience Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules Experience defining KPI's/SLA's used to drive multi-million dollar businesses and reporting to senior leadership Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $119,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $231,400/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Senior Program Manager
description: 5+ years of program or project management experience Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements Experience owning program strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership Interested in Android apps and devices such as Amazon’s Fire Tablets and Fire TV? Are you excited by the sense of ownership to manage projects at Amazonian scale? Do you enjoy working in a fast-paced environment to solve complex operational problems by delivering innovative solutions? In the Amazon Appstore team, we entertain, and delight across devices with a vast selection of relevant apps, games, and services by making it trivially easy for developers to deliver. Amazon Appstore Policy team is seeking an enthusiastic, detail-oriented policy manager for our global program focusing on policy governance and enforcement, consistency and scalability within Amazon. Devices are becoming increasingly sophisticated , and they are enabling customers to access content, applications, and services anywhere. This team researches, recommends, and develops the policies that govern, which apps are available from Amazon's global Appstore. Key job responsibilities The Sr Program Manager will work closely with Amazon leadership to set the long-term vision to support a trusted and safe environment for our customers, assess risk, and manage the consistent and accurate enforcement of our appstore policies worldwide. In this role you will continuously evaluate Appstore policies and standards, policy governance, enforcement, and escalation processes. You will be the voice of our policies and standards for developers, and internal customers, to ensure a broad understanding of the intent, philosophy, and customer obsession behind the policy decisions we make. You will work closely with our product, operations and engineering teams to improve policy mechanisms, analyze data to prioritize tool improvements, and help set the vision for automated review to enable policy governance at scale. You will lead a small team of policy program managers. As a Sr Program Manager, you will own Appstore Policy and work with globally-based teams to make things happen. You will deliver results when faced with ambiguous circumstances and roadblocks. Your judgment and intuition are right, a lot, and you know when to ask the right questions. We start with the customer and work backwards in everything we do. Develop policies that protect Amazon, our customers, and developers Build escalation tools and handle policy escalations from developers, business development teams, PR, and other internal stakeholders Prepare and deliver business reviews to executive leadership and business team regarding program/project progress and roadblocks Define program and organization wide metrics and ambitious goals Partner and influence product and engineering teams to drive solutions that scale and accurately enforce our policies Make balanced decisions content moderation questions Develop policies and governance frameworks to identify and resolve escalation scenarios Hire and develop a small team of policy program managers A day in the life We are looking for an energetic Sr Program Manager to come and lead some of the key initiatives within Appstore Policy. This is a strategic role to shape and deliver our vision in developing and delivering global program focusing on Appstore policy governance About the team EDS (Entertainment, Devices and Services) org’s mission is help hundreds of millions of people around the world relax, be entertained, and make their lives easier. The policy governance team works with the policy enforcement (tablets & fire tv) operationalizing, optimizing and improving execution frameworks for processes and technologies. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Seattle, WA, USA 2+ years of driving process improvements experience Master's degree, or MBA in business, operations, human resources, adult education, organizational development, instructional design or related field Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $92,500/year in our lowest geographic market up to $185,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Cliffhanger Games is a newly formed Seattle Studio focusing on blockbuster action-adventure games and pioneering next-generation emergent storytelling beginning with Marvel's Black Panther. Join us to pursue your passion to build unique, groundbreaking, and inclusive games that empower players to create incredible stories of heroic adventure. Become a foundational part of an ambitious, respectful and diverse team as we look for a Senior Infrastructure Engineer to join our team. You will build, maintain, and extend the production-grade tools and services that power our entire team’s development efforts. Applying a mix of Unreal Engine, Azure and proprietary internal tools, this engineer will strive to improve the developer experience ensuring optimal build tooling and artifact handling. You will also be trusted with handling the flow of new engine and tool versions into our development environment. You will report to our Tools Lead for technical guidance and an Engineering Manager to ensure professional growth and well-being. You will also have access to peers in similar roles across EA to learn from, collaborate with and grow. Responsibilities Collaborate with team members to improve our development infrastructure; developing, maintaining and extending the tools that our team relies on to do their work every day. Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities and establish requirements Identify solutions (3rd party evaluations, homegrown implementations), then adopt / develop / maintain your systems to meet all functional and technical requirements. Work with QA and technical leadership to ensure stability and robustness of your systems and production on scheduling and roll-outs. Support systems with documentation, training and debug tooling. Help grow your knowledge and that of those around you by collaborating with your peers via impromptu conversations, technical discussions and code reviews Be supportive of those around you and open to exploring, proposing or adopting new ideas, technologies and practices Qualifications Experience troubleshooting issues with users and communicating updates and resolutions to team members Experience supporting development teams, delivering and maintaining infrastructure-level systems optimized for developer up-time. Experience with Unreal Engine (Cloud DDC, GameSync, RoboMerge, Virtual Assets a plus) Extensive experience with source control (Perforce preferred) and integrations 5+ years of experience working with cloud service provider platforms (Azure preferred) Experience using NET, C#, and C++ and working with SQL and non-SQL databases Appreciation for robust, maintainable, easily readable code COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS The base salary ranges listed below are for the defined geographic market pay zones in these locations. If you reside outside of these locations, a recruiter will advise on the range and benefits for your specific location. EA has listed the base salary ranges it in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in the locations listed, as of the time of this posting. Pay offered will be determined based on numerous relevant business and candidate factors including, for example, education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, and business or organizational needs. BASE SALARY RANGES California (depending on location e.g. Los Angeles vs. Sacramento): º $149,150 - $233,500 USD Annually New York (depending on location e.g. Manhattan vs. Buffalo): º $136,000 - $233,500 USD Annually Jersey City, NJ : º $171,100 - $233,500 USD Annually Colorado (depending on location e.g. Denver vs. Colorado Springs): º $136,000 - $190,850 USD Annually Washington (depending on location e.g. Seattle vs. Spokane): º $136,000 - $218,900 USD Annually British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria): º $114,050 - $185,250 CAN Annually Base salary is just one part of the overall compensation at EA. In the US, we offer a package of benefits including paid time off (3 weeks per year to start), 80 hours per year of sick time, 16 paid company holidays per year, 10 weeks paid time off to bond with baby, medical/dental/vision insurance, life insurance, disability insurance, and 401(k) to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity. For British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity. We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Technical Program Manager
description: 5+ years of technical product or program management experience 7+ years of working directly with engineering teams experience 3+ years of software development experience 5+ years of technical program management working directly with software engineering teams experience Experience managing programs across cross functional teams, building processes and coordinating release schedules Come build the future as a Technical Program Manager III at Amazon, where you will be inspired working along-side best-in-class inventors and innovators! You will have the opportunity to create meaningful experiences that deliver on the ever-evolving needs of our customers, and your work will impact millions of people around the world. Apply now and you will be eligible for Amazon Technical Program Manager III positions that are based on your preferred location, team, tech stack, domain, language and more. We’re hiring across Amazon Stores in the United States and Canada. Teams with available positions including, but are not limited to: Consumer Technology: Build new generation features and products for amazon.com, constantly improving the Customer and Seller experience for billions around the globe. Whether building site wide features such as reviews and recommendations, category specific software for the likes of Pharmacy, Electronics, Digital Software and Video Games or seller infrastructure, there are a variety of complex problems to tackle using a range of technologies in the design of your technical solutions. Operations Technology: Shape the future of transportation planning and execution on a global scale, that impacts hundreds of fulfillment centers, thousands of Amazonians, and millions of customers across the world. Your technology will support thousands of operators worldwide to design, build and run the best-in-class Amazon transportation network. We are building intelligent software to make transportation more reliable, faster, and less costly, providing a better and less expensive experience for our customers. Financial Technology: Create next generation of distributed, scalable financial systems that support Amazon's current and future business needs. Use big data technologies to design and develop services that facilitate global financial transactions worth billions annually. You’ll lead architecture, design, implementation and deployment of large-scale critical and complex financial applications, owning all aspects of solutions end-to-end, through full stack software development. Human Resources Technology: Create a seamless experience for millions of Amazonians and/or candidates. Whether supporting technologies for onboarding, time and attendance, compensation, ama-zon.jobs, or recruiting, you’ll deliver robust feature sets, elegant designs, intuitive user interfaces and systems that make it easy for Amazonians to excel at performing critical business functions. Depending on your experience, Technical Program Manager III can typically expect to directly engage with developers and customers to address challenging problems, build software with the latest technologies and make da-ta-driven decisions to improve the customer experience. Your responsibilities extend to scaling systems by man-aging internal and external stakeholders across various domains, from business and operations to engineering, science, and deployment. As a Senior TPM, you will navigate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, make strategic tradeoffs, and balance business needs with technical constraints. The role also involves scoping and delivering large projects end-to-end, collecting requirements, writing specifications, and coordinating de-sign/implementation efforts. Ideally, you possess a strong program management background, demonstrated experience leading medium to large projects, and a well-rounded technical proficiency in current web technologies. About the team Here at Amazon, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust. We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations: Arlington, VA, USA | Bellevue, WA, USA | Los Angeles, CA, USA | Nashville, TN, USA | New York, NY, USA | Phoenix, AZ, USA | Seattle, WA, USA 5+ years of project management disciplines including scope, schedule, budget, quality, along with risk and critical path management experience Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules Experience defining KPI's/SLA's used to drive multi-million dollar businesses and reporting to senior leadership Oral and written English communication skills. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us. Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $119,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $231,400/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Software Engineer
description: As an Engineering Manager at PlayEveryWare you'll be critical to the success of port projects and co-development initiatives. You’ll work alongside indie and AAA development teams on unique and exciting games with no two projects ever the same. Our focus on console ports, co-development, and original development provides the opportunity to work on cutting edge technology with world-class developers and teams across the globe. This opportunity is for a full-time, benefits eligible position in Seattle, WA. Manager, Software Engineering At PlayEveryWare, no two projects are exactly alike. We work on cutting edge technology and bring games to previous and current generation consoles. Each project brings exciting new technical challenges and opportunities to learn, adapt, and grow. We invite you to join our team of experienced industry veterans to stretch the limits of your skills and push your expertise into new areas with these unique projects. As an Engineering Manager at PlayEveryWare, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our engineering team. Your responsibilities extend beyond project management to actively fostering the growth and development of each team member. You'll be instrumental in recruiting top talent, ensuring that our team not only maintains its high standards but also continues to evolve with the industry's best. Additionally, you'll be charged with continually assessing and refining our engineering processes. This role requires a balance of technical expertise, leadership acumen, and a visionary approach to team development and process innovation. Your contributions will directly impact the efficiency, effectiveness, and culture of our engineering team, making you a key driver of our continued success in the dynamic world of game development. If you excel in leading teams towards innovative solutions, are adept at navigating and improving complex systems, and possess exceptional strategic, technical, and communication skills, we invite you to lead our team to new heights. Responsibilities Guide and mentor software engineers from multiple teams, fostering an environment of growth and development Work with technical leads to help them guide the architecture, design, and development of software systems, ensuring alignment with project goals and company standards Manage project timelines, resources, and deliverables in collaboration with other departments Conduct code reviews and maintain high standards of code quality and system reliability Facilitate effective communication and collaboration within the team and with external partners Develop and implement strategies for continuous improvement in development processes and team performance Foster leadership and ownership throughout the studio Guide teams in problem-solving and decision-making for technical challenges Contribute to the recruitment, hiring, and onboarding of engineers Contribute to fostering a healthy satisfied team and sustainable company culture that is aligned with the company’s values Cultivate a proactive work culture and lead by example to anticipate challenges, streamline processes, and ensure timely resolution of issues Qualifications 5+ years of experience in the games industry or 10+ years in a related field, demonstrating strong leadership and success in diverse codebases Deep proficiency in C/C++ and familiarity with multiplatform development 2+ years of experience with Unreal Engine (UE4/UE5) Expertise in Perforce and Git version control systems Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and communication skills Proven ability in project risk management, task organization, and milestone operationalization Strong adaptability, task management, and delegation skills Experience developing on game consoles and proficient in debugging across multiple devices BA/BS or MS in Computer Science, or equivalent experience Commitment to studio values, including active listening, empathy, and servant leadership Vast technical knowledge across multiple engineering disciplines Nice to have 2+ years of professional experience with Unity and a strong command of C# Experience shipping at least one high-profile or professional game title in UE4 Development experience on current-generation game consoles, with a history of leading engineering teams in console development Proficiency in Japanese for communication with teams and partners This role is open to multiple levels based on experience and skills for the job Washington State Pay Range $125,000—$160,000 USD Benefits & Perks 100% covered health care, vision, dental insurance with affordable options for addition of dependants 401(k) retirement savings and profit sharing plan Life and disability insurance, Healthcare Savings Account 56 hours of sick time, 11 floating holidays, and additional PTO No Mandatory Crunch policy Close relationships with Epic, Unity, and first-party console developers Open and collaborative workspace with available on-site parking and gym Subsidized ORCA transit card for employees working 3 days in the office Casual and inclusive office environment nearby cafes and restaurants Company events, SWAG, and snack stocked kitchen Friday team lunch PlayEveryWare does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or any protected category prohibited by local, state, or federal laws. We are committed to advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion within our organization and the game development industry at large. Those with underrepresented identities, including but not limited to the above, are encouraged to apply.
